translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on circular

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthampi pādampi kīḷāpentā antaraghare gacchanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū hattham pi pādam pi kīḷāpentāḥ antaraghare gacchanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with their hands and feet hanging down.

analyzed: susavutaḥ antaraghare gamissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will walk in inhabited areas well-controlled,’ this is how you should train.”
One should walk in inhabited areas well-controlled.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca hatthaṁ vā pādaṁ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca hattham vā pādam vā kīḷāpentaḥ antaraghare gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with his hands or feet hanging down, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,🔽if he is sick,
if he is the first offender.🔽The fifth training rule is finished.
